com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api

Interface InputLink

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Link

    public interface InputLink
extends Link
    Interface for manipulating incoming Record objects.
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • readRecord

        InputRecord readRecord()
        Reads the next available record from this link.

        The typical use is to call this method once every time Processor.process() is invoked, perform a transformation, and write a result on an output link, or in an external target.

        When this method returns null, it means that no more rows are available on this link. When all the links reach that point, it is either the end of the job (Processor.process() will not be called anymore), or it is the end of the current "wave" (#process might be called again).

        Returns:
        The next available {link InputRecord} object or null if there is no more records available.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the processor has not been initialized.
        UnsupportedOperationException - if called at design time.

      • getAssociatedRejectLink

        OutputLink getAssociatedRejectLink()
        Gets a reject link associated with this input link.
        Returns:
        A OutputLink object of a reject link, or null if no reject links associated.
        See Also:
        OutputLink.getRejectRecord(com.ibm.is.cc.javastage.api.InputRecord), RejectRecord
